snippet: Even if the health care law is overturned, or repealed after the next election, the economic pressure to care differently for more people at lower cost is irreversible.
abstract: Hospitals across the country, like Maimonides Medical Center in Brooklyn, are already implementing the policies driving the federal health care law despite the uncertainty of its future; the Supreme Court is to decide whether the law will stand, but even if the health care law is overturned, or repealed after the next election, the economic pressure to care differently for more people at lower cost is irreversible.
lead_paragraph: Even if the health care law is overturned, or repealed after the next election, the economic pressure to care differently for more people at lower cost is irreversible.

headline.seo: Maimonides Medical Center Grapples With Health Care Uncertainty
headline.main: Hospitals Aren’t Waiting for Verdict on Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Health Care Law’s Fate Aside, Hospitals Evolve

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
